Responsible for all procurement activities within the grocery department including product ordering, inventory management, and financial analysis. Assisted ATL and Team Leader in running a successful department using a strong customer-centric approach combined with proven merchandising techniques to drive sales, grow revenue, and increase profitability by more than 20% in the first year.● Strong understanding of grocery department financials and methodology.● Well-developed set of customer service skills and extensive product knowledge.● Full comprehension of vendor requirements and deadlines.

Talks By DoBosh is a cyber-safety organization that specializes providing “live” and in-person presentations to middle and high school students about the dangers that exist online today. Topics include cyber-bullying, sexting, social-networking safety, and online predator awareness. As of January 2013, we have successfully made presentations to more than 50,000 students, parents and teachers combined on the dangers that exist in cyberspace.Administrative responsibilities:•Established and maintained performance bench marks, managing business finances and ledgers, and developing operational policies.•Evaluated new technologies to grow and streamline the business.•Developed and implemented marketing initiatives to maximize company exposure to prospective clients. •Worked with creative graphic design, Marketing and Creative Directors and IT team to develop web content, search engine optimization, marketing materials, and Google analytics in order to reach target markets and effectively brand products and services.
Director of Print Production and Purchasing

Reporting directly to the company’s president, primary responsibilities included:•	Managing all print production work including bid requests, quotation analysis, proofing, sign-offs and approvals, trafficking, and delivery schedules.•	Directing the print product by collaborating with key internal partners including Creative, Editorial, and Merchandising.•	Negotiating pricing and contracts for all commercial printing, paper buys, and pre-press services.•	Overseeing timelines and production calendar for all print projects to ensure on-time delivery of all marketing materials.•	Working closely with Marketing and Creative Directors on development of all promotional materials, including regular review of layouts, proofs, budgets, and timelines.•	Maintaining detailed job history for all direct marketing projects—including budgeted vs. actual project costs, supplier performance metrics, and quality assurance targets.•	Establishing management control systems, schedules, projections; budgetary and financial forecasts.•	Key director in development of online presence for educational and publishing product categories.•	Led development of profitable new website promoting and administering biannual marketing promotion.

Dream Come True of Western Connecticut

Dream Come True started it's mission in 1984 to  help grant dreams to seriously, chronically, and terminally ill children from Fairfield, Litchfield, and New Haven counties.It is a non-profit, volunteer based organization., supported by  local donations and a variety of fund-raising events.

The Brookfield Lacrosse Program will be hosting its 4th annual Shamrock Run for a Goal 5K road race on March 20th 2016 in Brookfield, CT. Taking on the challenge of this fundraising endeavor is both exciting and inspiring. This year we are dedicating our efforts to raise money for Hope for Heroes and for the Brookfield Girls and Boys High School Lacrosse programs for the purchase of new uniforms and helmets.Hope for Heroes is a nonprofit organization that combines a deep love and passion for outdoor activities with emotional and spiritual healing for Military, Fire, Police, and EMS personnel, who’ve experienced life altering disabilities while in the line of duty.

I've known Brian for five years now. I had the chance to work with him on an independent social networking project several years ago, for which he was in charge of website design and revisions, development of new products, and order form creation for web marketing programs. He is tactful and courteous with his thoughts and actions, and this invariably reflects in his work as well. I have a high regard for Brian’s skills, experience and attitude and can recommend him unconditionally to anyone looking for a top performing manager.

Sherri Keefe
CM Property Management, Bookkeeper
February 27, 2013, Brian was senior to Sherri but didn’t manage directly

It has been a pleasure to work with Sherri at the Writer’s Institute for the last 10 years. Simply stated, she is the best Finance Manager we have ever had here. Sherri sets high standards and expects superior performance and results.  She keeps her workers’ long-term interests in focus while nonetheless accomplishing what is necessary for the business. She is strongly pro-company in her attitudes and demeanor – and she is at her best when the going is the roughest.  She is very loyal on a company and personal level.

summary: After 25 years in the printing industry I finally understand what it is like to wake up everyday excited to go to work. Eight months ago I discovered my passion for my development and embarked on my second career as an autodidact front-end developer. Since then have completed over a dozen lynda.com courses, and developed a handful of interactive and responsive web applications (with a little help from stack overflow). I am currently seeking a junior level front-end developer position that will provide me the opportunity to expand my development knowledge and put my newly acquired skills into action!
